back.英释: in the opposite direction from the way you are facing

once.英释: from the time when something happens

open.英释: to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way

able.英释: Someone who is able is very intelligent or very good at doing something

home.英释: the house, apartment, or place where you live

rise.英释: to increase in number, amount, or value

last.英释: If an event, situation, or problem lasts for a particular length of time, it continues to exist or happen for that length of time

left.英释: the side of your body that contains your heart

site.英释: If something is sited in a particular place or position, it is put there or built there

thus.英释: as a result of something that you have just mentioned

melt.英释: if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid

vary.英释: if something varies, it changes depending on the situation

deep.英释: a long way into or below the surface of something

role.英释: the way in which someone or something is involved in an activity or situation, and how much influence they have on it

tend.英释: to look after someone or something

lack.英释: when there is not enough of something, or none of it

away.英释: used to say that someone leaves a place or person, or stays some distance from a place or person

snow.英释: if it snows, snow falls from the sky

salt.英释: to add salt to food to preserve it

hunt.英释: to look for someone or something very carefully

clay.英释: a type of heavy sticky earth that can be used for making pots, bricks etc

turn.英释: to move your body so that you are looking in a different direction

wide.英释: including or involving a large variety of different people, things, or situations

lake.英释: a large area of water surrounded by land

warm.英释: to make someone or something warm or warmer, or to become warm or warmer

foot.英释: the part of your body that you stand on and walk on

hard.英释: using a lot of effort, energy, or attention

near.英释: only a short distance away from someone or something

deer.英释: a large wild animal that can run very fast, eats grass, and has horns

past.英释: used to say that an unpleasant experience has ended and can be forgotten

flow.英释: a smooth steady movement of liquid, gas, or electricity

seed.英释: to give a player or team in a competition a particular position, according to how likely they are to win

rain.英释: if it rains, drops of water fall from clouds in the sky

town.英释: a large area with houses, shops, offices etc where people live and work, that is smaller than a city and larger than a village

pass.英释: to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them

slow.英释: to become slower or to make something slower

name.英释: to give someone or something a particular name

draw.英释: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

test.英释: a set of questions, exercises, or practical activities to measure someone’s skill, ability, or knowledge

cost.英释: to make someone suffer a lot or to lose something important

swim.英释: to move yourself through water using your arms and legs

half.英释: one of two equal parts of something

face.英释: if you face or are faced with a difficult situation, or if a difficult situation faces you, it is going to affect you and you must deal with it

mark.英释: to write or draw on something, so that someone will notice what you have written

wood.英释: the material that trees are made of

fire.英释: to force someone to leave their job

core.英释: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple

easy.英释: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort

cold.英释: a common illness that makes it difficult to breathe through your nose and often makes your throat hurt

cell.英释: the smallest part of a living thing that can exist independently

hour.英释: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour, and 24 hours in one day.

sell.英释: to give something to someone in exchange for money

rare.英释: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

cool.英释: to make something slightly colder, or to become slightly colder

want.英释: to have a desire for something

baby.英释: a very young child who has not yet learned to speak or walk

bone.英释: one of the hard parts that together form the frame of a human, animal, or fish body

read.英释: to look at written words and understand what they mean

meet.英释: to see someone by chance and talk to them

whig.英释: A Whig was a member of an American political party in the 19th century that wanted to limit the powers of the president

coal.英释: a hard black mineral which is dug out of the ground and burnt to produce heat

book.英释: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them

sand.英释: a substance consisting of very small pieces of rocks and minerals, that forms beaches and deserts

leaf.英释: one of the flat green parts of a plant that are joined to its stem or branches

star.中释: 以星状物装饰,变成演员

huge.英释: extremely large in size, amount, or degree

soon.英释: in a short time from now, or a short time after something else happens

fill.英释: if a container or place fills, or if you fill it, enough of something goes into it to make it full

fort.英释: a strong building or group of buildings used by soldiers or an army for defending an important place

link.英释: a way in which two things or ideas are related to each other

step.英释: to bring your foot down on something

plan.英释: to think carefully about something you want to do, and decide how and when you will do it

mile.英释: a unit for measuring distance, equal to 1,760  yard s  or about 1,609 metres

road.英释: a specially prepared hard surface for cars, buses, bicycles etc to travel on

bank.英释: to put or keep money in a bank

feed.英释: to give food to a person or animal

bear.英释: to bravely accept or deal with a painful, difficult, or upsetting situation

park.英释: to put a car or other vehicle in a particular place for a period of time

loss.英释: the fact of no longer having something, or of having less of it than you used to have, or the process by which this happens

real.英释: something that is real exists and is important

task.英释: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly

mine.英释: to dig large holes in the ground in order to remove coal, gold etc

host.英释: someone at a party, meal etc who has invited the guests and who provides the food, drink etc

note.英释: to notice or pay careful attention to something

drop.英释: a reduction in the amount, level, or number of something, especially a large or sudden one

dust.英释: When you dust something such as furniture, you remove dust from it, usually using a cloth

fuel.英释: if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

blue.英释: having the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day

shop.英释: to go to one or more shops to buy things

push.英释: to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc

wear.英释: to have something such as clothes, shoes, or jewellery on your body

hide.英释: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

tell.英释: if someone tells you something, they communicate information, a story, their feelings etc to you

head.英释: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck

wave.英释: if you wave something, or if it waves, it moves from side to side

moon.英释: the round object that you can see shining in the sky at night, and that moves around the Earth every 28 days

spot.英释: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

fail.英释: to not succeed in achieving something

free.英释: to allow someone to leave prison or somewhere they have been kept as a prisoner

atom.英释: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

item.英释: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

skin.英释: the natural outer layer of a person’s or animal’s body

gain.英释: to obtain or achieve something you want or need

song.英释: a short piece of music with words that you sing

soft.英释: a soft sound or voice, or soft music, is quiet and pleasant to listen to

stem.英释: to stop something from happening, spreading, or developing

rely.英释: If you rely on someone or something, you need them and depend on them in order to live or work properly

dark.英释: when there is no light, especially because the sun has gone down

wild.英释: in natural and free conditions, not kept or controlled by people

ship.英释: to send goods somewhere by ship, plane, truck etc

case.英释: an example of a particular situation or of something happening

diet.英释: an official meeting to discuss political or church matters

rest.英释: a period of time when you are not doing anything tiring and you can relax or sleep

hear.英释: to know that a sound is being made, using your ears

crow.英释: if a  cock  crows, it makes a loud high sound

unit.英释: an amount of something used as a standard of measurement

fear.英释: to feel afraid or worried that something bad may happen

inch.英释: a unit for measuring length, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.

prey.英释: A creature that preys on other creatures lives by catching and eating them

edge.英释: to move gradually with several small movements, or to make something do this

boat.英释: a vehicle that travels across water

feel.英释: If you feel a particular emotion or physical sensation, you experience it

jazz.英释: a type of music that has a strong beat and parts for performers to play alone

poor.英释: used to show sympathy for someone because they are so unlucky, unhappy etc

pump.英释: a machine for forcing liquid or gas into or out of something

rule.英释: to have the official power to control a country and the people who live there

game.英释: how well someone plays a particular game or sport

suit.英释: to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

kill.英释: to make a person or animal die

tone.英释: the way your voice sounds, which shows how you are feeling or what you mean

join.英释: to become a member of an organization, society, or group

care.英释: the process of looking after someone, especially because they are ill, old, or very young

army.英释: the part of a country’s military force that is trained to fight on land in a war

seek.英释: to look for someone or something

hole.英释: to hit the ball into a hole in golf

flat.英释: smooth and level, without raised or hollow areas, and not sloping or curving

burn.英释: an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

pull.英释: to use your hands to make something or someone move towards you or in the direction that your hands are moving

tuna.英释: a large sea fish caught for food

goal.英释: something that you hope to achieve in the future

trap.英释: a clever trick that is used to catch someone or to make them do or say something that they did not intend to

walk.英释: a journey that you make by walking, especially for exercise or enjoyment

pure.英释: a pure substance or material is not mixed with anything

stay.英释: to remain in a place rather than leave

send.英释: to arrange for something to go or be taken to another place, especially by post

week.英释: a period of seven days and nights, usually measured in Britain from Monday to Sunday and in the US from Sunday to Saturday

risk.英释: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

myth.英释: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

arid.英释: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

arch.英释: a structure with a curved top and straight sides that supports the weight of a bridge or building

tail.英释: to follow someone and watch what they do, where they go etc

lung.英释: one of the two organs in your body that you breathe with

peak.英释: the time when something or someone is best, greatest, highest, most successful etc

bead.英释: one of a set of small, usually round, pieces of glass, wood, plastic etc, that you can put on a string and wear as jewellery

meat.英释: the flesh of animals and birds eaten as food

tall.英释: a person, building, tree etc that is tall is a greater height than normal

mill.英释: to crush grain, pepper etc in a mill

stop.英释: to prevent someone from doing something or something from happening

mask.英释: something that covers all or part of your face, to protect or to hide it

suck.英释: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in

room.英释: a part of the inside of a building that has its own walls, floor, and ceiling

corn.英释: a tall plant with large yellow seeds that grow together on a  cob (= long hard part )  , which is cooked and eaten as a vegetable or fed to animals

talk.英释: to say things to someone as part of a conversation

love.英释: to have a strong feeling of  affection  for someone, combined with sexual attraction

mind.英释: to feel annoyed or upset about something

full.英释: containing as much or as many things or people as possible, so there is no space left

copy.英释: to deliberately make or produce something that is exactly like another thing

lens.英释: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

rail.英释: to complain angrily about something, especially something that you think is very unfair

post.英释: to send a letter, package etc by post

lock.英释: to fasten something, usually with a key, so that other people cannot open it, or to be fastened like this （

hind.英释: relating to the back part of an animal with four legs

fern.英释: a type of plant with green leaves shaped like large feathers, but no flowers

list.英释: to write a list, or mention things one after the other

rent.英释: the money that someone pays regularly to use a room, house etc that belongs to someone else

pore.英释: one of the small holes in your skin that liquid, especially  sweat  , can pass through, or a similar hole in the surface of a plant

cast.英释: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere

none.英释: not any amount of something or not one of a group of people or things

cage.英释: a structure made of wires or bars in which birds or animals can be kept

clue.英释: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

vent.英释: to express feelings of anger, hatred etc, especially by doing something violent or harmful

pole.英释: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something

miss.英释: to not go somewhere or do something, especially when you want to but cannot

pool.英释: a hole or container that has been specially made and filled with water so that people can swim or play in it

coat.英释: to cover something with a thin layer of something else

coin.英释: to invent a new word or expression, especially one that many people start to use

news.英释: information about something that has happened recently

hill.英释: an area of land that is higher than the land around it, like a mountain but smaller

rite.英释: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, usually for religious purposes

gulf.英释: a large area of sea partly enclosed by land

bond.英释: if two things bond with each other, they become firmly fixed together, especially after they have been joined with glue

tile.英释: a flat square piece of baked clay or other material, used for covering walls, floors etc

rank.英释: to arrange objects in a line or row

sink.英释: to go down below the surface of water, mud etc

self.英释: the type of person you are, your character, your typical behaviour etc

sort.英释: a group or class of people, things etc that have similar qualities or features

mode.英释: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

firm.英释: a business or company, especially a small one

fund.英释: to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc

emit.英释: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

mail.英释: the letters and packages that are delivered to you

tide.英释: the regular rising and falling of the level of the sea

roof.英释: the structure that covers or forms the top of a building, vehicle, tent etc

pose.英释: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this

blow.英释: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves

pair.英释: an object that is made from two similar parts that are joined together

hang.英释: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

gene.英释: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

load.英释: to put a necessary part into something in order to make it work, for example bullets into a gun or film into a camera

spin.英释: to turn around and around very quickly, or to make something do this

crab.英释: a sea animal with a hard shell, five legs on each side, and two large  claws

Erie.英释: a member of a North American Indian people formerly living south of Lake Erie

text.英释: the writing that forms the main part of a book, magazine etc, rather than the pictures or notes

sing.英释: to produce a musical sound with your voice

bake.英释: to cook something using dry heat, in an  oven

sail.英释: to travel on or across an area of water in a boat or ship

seat.英释: if a place seats a number of people, it has enough seats for that number

boom.英释: to make a loud deep sound

seal.英释: a piece of rubber or plastic that keeps air, water, dirt etc out of something

save.英释: to keep something so that you can use or enjoy it in the future

king.英释: a man who rules a country because he is from a royal family

dome.英释: a round roof on a building

tube.英释: a round pipe made of metal, glass, rubber etc, especially for liquids or gases to go through

kiln.英释: a special oven for baking clay pots, bricks etc

drag.英释: to pull something along the ground, often because it is too heavy to carry

path.英释: the direction or line along which something or someone is moving

pick.英释: to choose a person or thing, for example because they are the best or most suitable

cent.英释: 1/100th of the standard unit of money in some countries. For example, there are 100 cents in one dollar or in one  euro  : symbol ¢.

rush.英释: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon

bite.英释: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

harm.英释: to have a bad effect on something

roll.英释: if something rolls, especially something round, or if you roll it, it moves along a surface by turning over and over

acre.英释: a unit for measuring area, equal to 4,840 square yards or 4,047 square metres

page.英释: one side of a piece of paper in a book, newspaper, document etc, or the sheet of paper itself

race.英释: one of the main groups that humans can be divided into according to the colour of their skin and other physical features

lava.英释: hot liquid rock that flows from a volcano,or this rock when it has become solid

pace.英释: Your pace is the speed at which you walk

norm.英释: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

cope.英释: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation

twig.英释: a small very thin stem of wood that grows from a branch on a tree

herb.英释: a small plant that is used to improve the taste of food, or to make medicine

chip.英释: to cut potatoes into thin pieces ready to be cooked in hot oil

cook.英释: A cook is a person whose job is to prepare and cook food, especially in someone's home or in an institution

rice.英释: a food that consists of small white or brown grains that you boil in water until they become soft enough to eat

seep.英释: to flow slowly through small holes or spaces

bell.英释: a piece of electrical equipment that makes a ringing sound, used as a signal or to get someone’s attention

tire.英释: to start to feel tired, or make someone feel tired

lift.英释: to move something or someone upwards into the air

lend.英释: to let someone borrow money or something that belongs to you for a short time

wool.英释: the soft thick hair that sheep and some goats have on their body

oven.英释: a piece of equipment that food is cooked inside, shaped like a metal box with a door on the front

wait.英释: to stay somewhere or not do something until something else happens, someone arrives etc

pack.英释: something wrapped in paper or packed in a box and then sent by post or taken somewhere

slip.英释: to slide a short distance accidentally, and fall or lose your balance slightly

else.英释: You use else after words such as "anywhere," "someone," and "what" to refer in a vague way to another person, place, or thing

herd.英释: to bring people together in a large group, especially roughly

gill.英释: one of the organs on the sides of a fish through which it breathes

feat.英释: something that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength etc to do

warn.英释: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it

hope.英释: to want something to happen or be true and to believe that it is possible or likely

palm.英释: the inside surface of your hand, in which you hold things

pile.英释: a group of several things of the same type that are put on top of each other

lion.英释: a large animal of the cat family that lives in Africa and parts of southern Asia. Lions have gold-coloured fur and the male has a mane(= long hair around its neck ).

hire.英释: to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time

wash.英释: to clean something using water and a type of soap

drum.英释: a musical instrument made of skin stretched over a circular frame, played by hitting it with your hand or a stick

cone.英释: a solid or hollow shape that is round at one end, has sloping sides, and has a point at the other end, or something with this shape

fade.英释: to lose colour and brightness, or to make something do this

lord.英释: a man in  medieval  Europe who was very powerful and owned a lot of land

debt.英释: a sum of money that a person or organization owes

mild.中释: 温和的, 轻微的,适度的

poem.英释: a piece of writing that expresses emotions, experiences, and ideas, especially in short lines using words that  rhyme (= end with the same sound )

eddy.英释: a circular movement of water, wind, dust etc

silk.英释: a thin smooth soft cloth made from very thin thread which is produced by a silkworm

zinc.英释: a blue-white metal that is used to make brass and to cover and protect objects made of iron. It is a chemical element: symbol Zn

flee.英释: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

bulb.英释: a root shaped like a ball that grows into a flower or plant

buck.英释: A buck is a U.S. or Australian dollar.

wife.英释: the woman that a man is married to

safe.英释: a strong metal box or cupboard with special locks where you keep money and valuable things

raft.中释: 木排(筏),救生圈 v用筏子渡河
raft.英释: a flat floating structure, usually made of pieces of wood tied together, used as a boat

shed.英释: to drop something or allow it to fall

bend.英释: to become curved and no longer flat or straight

tape.英释: a long thin piece of plastic or cloth used for purposes such as marking out an area of ground or tying things together

hair.英释: the mass of things like fine threads that grows on your head

beam.英释: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc

tomb.英释: a stone structure above or below the ground where a dead person is buried

trip.英释: a visit to a place that involves a journey, for pleasure or a particular purpose

bury.英释: to put someone who has died in a  grave

soda.英释: water that contains bubbles and is often added to alcoholic drinks

moth.英释: an insect related to the  butterfly  that flies mainly at night and is attracted to lights. Some moths eat holes in cloth.

door.英释: the large flat piece of wood, glass etc that you move when you go into or out of a building, room, vehicle etc, or when you open a cupboard

coma.英释: someone who is in a coma has been unconscious for a long time, usually because of a serious illness or injury

moss.英释: a very small green plant that grows in a thick soft furry mass on wet soil, trees, or rocks

ward.英释: a large room in a hospital where people who need medical treatment stay

sure.中释: 对有把握 ad的确, 当然
sure.英释: confident that you know something or that something is true or correct

wrap.英释: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it

jump.英释: to let yourself drop from a place that is above the ground

hurt.英释: to injure yourself or someone else

wish.英释: a desire to do something, to have something, or to have something happen

wale.英释: the raised mark left on the skin after the stroke of a rod or whip

cure.英释: the act of making someone well again after an illness

chew.英释: to bite food several times before swallowing it

boil.中释: 沸点 v煮沸, 激动
boil.英释: the act or state of boiling

homo.英释: a very offensive word for a  homosexual

nose.英释: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing

wolf.英释: a wild animal that looks like a large dog and lives and hunts in groups

bore.中释: 使厌烦 n令人讨厌的人(或事)
bore.英释: to make someone feel bored, especially by talking too much about something they are not interested in

rear.英释: The rear of something such as a building or vehicle is the back part of it

team.英释: a group of people who play a game or sport together against another group

hall.英释: a building or large room for public events such as meetings or dances

putt.英释: to hit a golf ball lightly a short distance along the ground towards the hole

pond.英释: a small area of fresh water that is smaller than a lake, that is either natural or artificially made

crew.英释: all the people who work on a ship or plane

hawk.英释: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals

user.英释: someone or something that uses a product, service etc

plot.中释: 小块土地,(小说的)情节vt密谋
plot.英释: the events that form the main story of a book, film, or play

ooze.英释: very soft mud, especially at the bottom of a lake or sea

vote.英释: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

hero.英释: a man who is admired for doing something extremely brave

solo.英释: a piece of music for one performer

fame.英释: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

tune.英释: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to

sect.英释: a group of people with their own particular set of beliefs and practices, especially within or separated from a larger religious group

cite.英释: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

reef.英释: a line of sharp rocks, often made of  coral  , or a raised area of sand near the surface of the sea

busy.英释: if you are busy, you are working hard and have a lot of things to do

goat.英释: an animal that has horns on top of its head and long hair under its chin, and can climb steep hills and rocks. Goats live wild in the mountains or are kept as farm animals.

neon.英释: a colourless gas that is found in small quantities in the air and is used in glass tubes to produce a bright light in electric advertising signs. It is a chemical element: symbol Ne

cash.英释: money in the form of coins or notes rather than cheques,  credit card s  etc

tale.英释: a story about exciting imaginary events

cord.英释: a piece of thick string or thin rope

soap.英释: the substance that you use to wash your body

deaf.英释: physically unable to hear anything or unable to hear well

mood.英释: the way you feel at a particular time

dive.英释: to jump into deep water with your head and arms going in first

fuse.英释: a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power

ruin.英释: to spoil or destroy something completely

bind.英释: to stick together in a mass, or to make small pieces of something stick together

weed.英释: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly

fold.英释: the folds in material, skin etc are the loose parts that hang over other parts of it

wake.英释: to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping

worm.英释: a long thin creature with no bones and no legs that lives in soil

wage.英释: money you earn that is paid according to the number of hours, days, or weeks that you work

gate.英释: the part of a fence or outside wall that you can open and close so that you can enter or leave a place

pale.中释: 苍白的；淡的 vi变得苍白，变得暗淡

loft.英释: a room or space under the roof of a building, usually used for storing things in

luck.英释: good things that happen to you by chance

gear.英释: If someone or something is geared to or toward a particular purpose, they are organized or designed in order to achieve that purpose

port.英释: a place where ships can be loaded and unloaded

vein.英释: one of the tubes which carries blood to your heart from other parts of your body

card.英释: a small piece of plastic or paper containing information about a person or showing, for example, that they belong to a particular organization, club etc

glow.英释: to produce or  reflect  a soft steady light

beat.英释: to get the most points, votes etc in a game, race, or competition

leap.英释: if your heart leaps, you feel a sudden surprise, happiness, or excitement

reel.英释: a round object onto which film, wire, a special string for fishing etc can be wound

flaw.英释: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

male.英释: typical of or relating to men or boys

bean.英释: a seed or a  pod (=  case containing seeds  )  , that comes from a climbing plant and is cooked as food. There are very many types of beans.

bold.英释: not afraid of taking risks and making difficult decisions

file.中释: 文档 vt登记备案 ,提出
file.英释: a set of papers, records etc that contain information about a particular person or subject

pine.英释: a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter

slab.英释: a thick flat piece of a hard material such as stone

coil.英释: to wind or twist into a series of rings, or to make something do this

dirt.英释: any substance that makes things dirty, such as mud or dust

bias.英释: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

lamp.英释: an object that produces light by using electricity, oil, or gas

blur.英释: a shape that you cannot see clearly

tine.英释: a pointed part of something that has several points, for example a fork

lime.英释: a white substance obtained by burning limestone, used for making cement, marking sports fields etc

ball.英释: a round object that is thrown, kicked, or hit in a game or sport

leak.英释: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through

meal.英释: an occasion when you eat food, for example breakfast or dinner, or the food that you eat on that occasion

shoe.英释: something that you wear to cover your feet, made of leather or some other strong material

glue.英释: a sticky substance used for joining things together

soak.英释: if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean

belt.英释: a band of leather, cloth etc that you wear around your waist to hold up your clothes or for decoration

cape.英释: a long loose piece of clothing without  sleeve s  that fastens around your neck and hangs from your shoulders

beak.英释: the hard pointed mouth of a bird

duck.英释: a very common water bird with short legs and a wide beak, used for its meat, eggs, and soft feathers

duty.英释: something that you have to do because it is morally or legally right

yard.英释: an enclosed area next to a building or group of buildings, used for a special purpose, activity, or business

haul.英释: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement

bent.英释: special natural skill or interest in a particular area

shut.英释: to close something, or to become closed

camp.英释: to set up a tent or shelter and stay there for a short time

foul.中释: 邪恶的,下流的 n犯规 v弄脏

mule.英释: an animal that has a  donkey  and a horse as parents

wipe.英释: to remove liquid, dirt, or marks by wiping

sick.英释: suffering from a disease or illness

nick.英释: a very small cut made on the edge or surface of something

pipe.英释: a tube through which a liquid or gas flows

mute.中释: 哑的,不发音的 vt消除(声音)
mute.英释: someone who is mute is unable to speak

glen.英释: a deep narrow valley in Scotland or Ireland

flax.英释: a plant with blue flowers, used for making cloth and oil

clan.英释: a large group of families who often share the same name

warp.英释: If something warps or is warped, it becomes damaged by bending or curving, often because of the effect of heat or water

reed.英释: a type of tall plant like grass that grows in wet places

Inca.中释: 印加人(古代秘鲁土著人)
Inca.英释: a member of a South American Indian people whose great empire centred on Peru lasted from about 1100 ad to the Spanish conquest in the early 1530s and is famed for its complex culture

void.英释: a contract or official agreement that is void is not legal and has no effect

toll.英释: A toll road or toll bridge is a road or bridge that you have to pay to use

milk.英释: a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people

rend.英释: to tear or break something violently into pieces

pest.英释: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies

pour.英释: to make a liquid or other substance flow out of or into a container by holding it at an angle

drug.英释: a medicine, or a substance for making medicines

plug.英释: If you plug a hole, you block it with something

bowl.英释: a wide round container that is open at the top, used to hold liquids, food, flowers etc

vase.英释: a container used to put flowers in or for decoration

dual.英释: having two of something or two parts

fate.英释: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

tram.英释: a vehicle for passengers, which travels along metal tracks in the street

frog.英释: a small green animal that lives near water and has long legs for jumping

snap.中释: 喀嚓折断,拍快照 n吧嗒声
snap.英释: If something snaps or if you snap it, it breaks suddenly, usually with a sharp cracking noise

calm.中释: 镇定的,平静的 v(使)平静
calm.英释: relaxed and quiet, not angry, nervous, or upset

barn.中释: [农]谷仓, 畜棚, 畜舍, 机器房
barn.英释: A barn is a building on a farm in which animals, animal food, or crops can be kept

joke.英释: something that you say or do to make people laugh, especially a funny story or trick

thaw.英释: a period of warm weather during which snow and ice melt

neck.英释: the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird

bath.英释: if you take a bath, you wash your body in a bath

spit.英释: the watery liquid that is produced in your mouth

dawn.中释: 黎明 vi破晓,开始出现
dawn.英释: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears

pram.英释: a small vehicle with four wheels in which a baby can lie down while it is being pushed

quit.英释: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

lace.中释: 花边,系带 vt用系带束紧
lace.英释: a fine cloth made with patterns of many very small holes

cyan.英释: a highly saturated green-blue that is the complementary colour of red and forms, with magenta and yellow, a set of primary colours

clam.英释: a  shellfish  you can eat that has a shell in two parts that open up

rope.英释: very strong thick string, made by twisting together many thinner strings

lobe.英释: the soft piece of flesh at the bottom of your ear

kick.英释: If you kick someone or something, you hit them forcefully with your foot

lady.英释: used as the title of the wife or daughter of a British noblemanor the wife of a knight

dare.英释: to be brave enough to do something that is risky or that you are afraid to do – used especially in questions or negative sentences

jade.英释: a hard, usually green stone often used to make jewellery

hook.英释: to bend your finger, arm, or leg, especially so that you can pull or hold something else

claw.英释: a sharp curved nail on an animal, bird, or some insects

plus.英释: used to show that one number or amount is added to another

reap.英释: to cut and collect a crop of grain

bask.英释: to enjoy sitting or lying in the heat of the sun or a fire

hare.英释: an animal like a rabbit but larger, which can run very quickly

heel.英释: the curved back part of your foot

pain.英释: If a fact or idea pains you, it makes you feel upset and disappointed

hail.英释: if it hails, small balls of ice fall like rain

slop.英释: if liquid slops somewhere, it moves around or over the edge of a container in an uncontrolled way

mist.英释: a light cloud low over the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far

poll.英释: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

ford.英释: a place where a river is not deep, so that you can walk or drive across it

mate.英释: the sexual partner of an animal

omit.英释: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

dime.英释: a coin of the US and Canada, worth one tenth of a dollar

roam.英释: to walk or travel, usually for a long time, with no clear purpose or direction

rage.英释: a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger

cart.英释: a vehicle with no roof that is pulled by a horse and used for carrying heavy things

gram.英释: the basic unit for measuring weight in the  metric system

rote.英释: when you learn something by repeating it many times, without thinking about it carefully or without understanding it

lane.英释: a narrow road in the countryside

hint.英释: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly

shin.英释: the front part of your leg between your knee and your foot

earn.英释: to make a profit from business or from putting money in a bank etc

levy.英释: to officially say that people must pay a tax or charge

June.英释: the sixth month of the year, between May and July

Arab.英释: someone whose language is Arabic and whose family comes from, or originally came from, the Middle East or North Africa

loom.英释: a frame or machine on which thread is woven into cloth

keen.英释: a keen knife or blade is extremely sharp

amid.英释: while noisy, busy, or confused events are happening – used in writing or news reports

lure.英释: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

peep.英释: to look at something quickly and secretly, especially through a hole or opening

ibex.英释: a wild goat that lives in the mountains of Europe, Asia, and North Africa

ride.英释: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and make it move along

vest.中释: 汗衫 vt使穿衣服, 授予
vest.英释: a piece of underwear without sleeves that you wear on the top half of your body

grid.英释: a metal frame with bars across it

pane.英释: a piece of glass used in a window or door

bark.英释: the sharp loud sound made by a dog

epic.英释: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

stag.中释: 牡鹿vi不带女伴参加晚会
stag.英释: if a man goes stag, he goes to a party without a woman

sake.英释: in order to help, improve, or please someone or something

kiwi.中释: [鸟]几维(一种新西兰产的无翼鸟)
kiwi.英释: a New Zealand bird that cannot fly

mint.英释: a small plant with green leaves that have a fresh smell and taste and are used in cooking

tent.英释: a shelter consisting of a sheet of cloth supported by poles and ropes, used especially for camping

heal.英释: to make someone who is ill become healthy again, especially by using natural powers or prayer

nail.英释: to fasten something to something else with nails

etch.英释: to cut lines on a metal plate, piece of glass, stone etc to form a picture or words

mast.英释: to equip with a mast or masts

scat.中释: 爵士音乐中无意义的音节的演唱

duke.英释: a man with the highest social rank outside the royal family

dale.英释: a valley – used in the past or in the names of places, especially in the North of England

fond.英释: to like someone very much, especially when you have known them for a long time and almost feel love for them

toad.英释: a small animal that looks like a large  frog  and lives mostly on land

volt.英释: a unit for measuring the force of an electric current

scar.英释: if a wound or cut scars you, it leaves a permanent mark on your body

spew.英释: to flow out of something quickly in large quantities, or to make something flow out in this way

shun.英释: to deliberately avoid someone or something

lump.英释: to collect into a mass or group

rust.英释: to become covered with rust, or to make something become covered in rust

fare.英释: If you say that someone or something fares well or badly, you are referring to the degree of success they achieve in a particular situation or activity

lawn.中释: 草坪, (均匀生长于固体培养基的)菌苔
lawn.英释: an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass

loop.英释: If you loop something such as a piece of rope around an object, you tie a length of it in a loop around the object, for example, in order to fasten it to the object

peat.英释: a black substance formed from decaying plants under the surface of the ground in some areas, which can be burned as a  fuel  , or mixed with soil to help plants grow well

dart.英释: If you dart a look at someone or something, or if your eyes dart to them, you look at them very quickly

bull.英释: an adult male animal of the cattle family

bode.英释: If something bodes ill, it makes you think that something bad will happen in the future. If something bodes well, it makes you think that something good will happen.

diva.英释: You can refer to a successful and famous female opera singer as a diva

sate.英释: to satisfy (a desire or appetite) fully

halt.英释: to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

knot.英释: to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc

deft.中释: 敏捷熟练的, 灵巧的
deft.英释: a deft movement is skilful, and often quick

lean.英释: If you describe periods of time as lean, you mean that people have less of something such as money or are less successful than they used to be

roar.英释: to shout something in a deep powerful voice

lira.英释: the standard unit of money in Malta and Turkey, and used in Italy before the euro

slit.英释: a long straight narrow cut or hole

pave.英释: to cover a path, road, area etc with a hard level surface such as blocks of stone or  concrete

envy.英释: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc

drip.英释: to let liquid fall in drops

lien.中释: 留置权,抵押品所产生的利息
lien.英释: the legal right to keep something that belongs to someone who owes you money, until the debt has been paid

heed.英释: to pay attention to someone’s advice or warning

ling.英释: any of several gadoid food fishes of the northern coastal genus Molva, esp M

spur.英释: to make an improvement or change happen faster

hoof.英释: the hard foot of an animal such as a horse, cow etc

gang.英释: a group of criminals who work together

toss.英释: to throw something, especially something light, with a quick gentle movement of your hand

Yuan.英释: The yuan is the unit of money used in the People's Republic of China

hiss.中释: 嘶嘶作声, 用嘘声表示
hiss.英释: To hiss means to make a sound like a long "s."

stir.英释: to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

hurl.中释: 用力或猛烈的投掷v用力投掷

deny.英释: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

obey.英释: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do

fork.中释: 叉, 叉状物 vi分叉
fork.英释: a tool you use for picking up and eating food, with a handle and three or four points

deed.英释: something someone does, especially something that is very good or very bad

bony.中释: 多骨的, 瘦骨嶙峋的
bony.英释: someone or part of their body that is bony is very thin

pear.英释: a sweet juicy fruit that has a round base and is thinner near the top, or the tree that produces this fruit

pray.英释: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

boss.中释: 老板, 上司 vt指挥
boss.英释: the person who employs you or who is in charge of you at work

mesh.英释: material made from threads or wires that have been woven together like a net, or a piece of this material

perm.英释: to make straight hair curly by using chemicals

kink.英释: a twist in something that is normally straight

grab.英释: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement

rape.英释: to force someone to have sex, especially by using violence

deck.英释: the outside top level of a ship that you can walk or sit on

gist.英释: the main idea and meaning of what someone has said or written

doll.英释: a child’s toy that looks like a small person or baby

trim.英释: to make something look neater by cutting small pieces off it

wine.英释: an alcoholic drink made from grapes, or a type of this drink

aide.英释: someone whose job is to help someone who has an important job, especially a politician

fray.英释: if cloth or other material frays, or if something frays it, the threads become loose because the material is old

weld.英释: to join metals by melting their edges and pressing them together when they are hot

anew.英释: to begin a different job, start to live in a different place etc, especially after a difficult period in your life

sago.英释: small white grains obtained from some  palm  trees, used to make sweet dishes with milk

taro.英释: a tropical plant grown for its thick root, which is boiled and eaten

puff.英释: to breathe quickly and with difficulty after the effort of running, carrying something heavy etc

pity.中释: 可怜 n怜悯, 同情
pity.英释: to feel sorry for someone because they are in a very bad situation

peck.英释: if a bird pecks something or pecks at something, it makes quick repeated movements with its beak to try to eat part of it, make a hole in it etc

mite.英释: a very small particle, creature, or object

wise.英释: wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment

flap.中释: 片状垂悬物；飘动 v飘动，拍动
flap.英释: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily

duet.英释: a piece of music for two singers or players

wand.英释: a thin stick that you hold in your hand to do magic tricks

cube.英释: a solid object with six equal square sides

bomb.英释: a weapon made of material that will explode

chop.英释: to cut something into smaller pieces

peal.英释: the loud ringing sound made by a bell

husk.英释: the dry outer part of corn, some grains, seeds, nuts etc

loam.英释: good quality soil consisting of sand, clay, and decayed plants

tray.英释: a flat piece of plastic, metal, or wood, with raised edges, used for carrying things such as plates, food etc

slot.英释: a long narrow hole in a surface, that you can put something into

gild.英释: to cover something with a thin layer of gold or with something that looks like gold

slat.英释: a thin flat piece of wood, plastic etc, used especially in furniture

verb.英释: a word or group of words that describes an action, experience, or state, such as ‘come’, ‘see’, and ‘put on’

dung.英释: Dung is faeces from animals, especially from large animals such as cattle and horses

moat.英释: a deep wide hole, usually filled with water, dug around a castle as a defence

Thai.英释: A Thai is a citizen of Thailand, or a person of Thai origin

woad.英释: a European plant, Isatis tinctoria, formerly cultivated for its leaves, which yield a blue dye: family Brassicaceae (crucifers)

mote.英释: a very small piece of dust

deem.英释: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

hike.英释: a long walk in the mountains or countryside

pulp.英释: the soft inside part of a fruit or vegetable

fist.英释: the hand when it is tightly closed, so that the fingers are curled in towards the  palm  . People close their hand in a fist when they are angry or are going to hit someone.

rake.英释: a gardening tool with a row of metal teeth at the end of a long handle, used for making soil level, gathering up dead leaves etc

slum.英释: a house or an area of a city that is in very bad condition, where very poor people live

disk.英释: a small flat piece of plastic or metal which is used for storing computer or electronic information

slam.英释: if a door, gate etc slams, or if someone slams it, it shuts with a loud noise

sash.英释: a long piece of cloth that you wear around your waist like a belt

tint.英释: a small amount of a particular colour

ploy.英释: a clever and dishonest way of tricking someone so that you can get an advantage

vole.英释: a small animal like a mouse with a short tail that lives in fields and woods and near rivers

beer.英释: an alcoholic drink made from  malt  and  hop s

kier.英释: a vat in which cloth is bleached

chic.英释: very fashionable and expensive, and showing good judgement of what is attractive and good style

blip.中释: （在雷达屏幕显示出的）物体光点, 尖音信号
blip.英释: A blip is a small spot of light, sometimes occurring with a short, high-pitched sound, which flashes on and off regularly on a piece of equipment such as a radar screen

sled.英释: A sled is the same as a

holm.英释: an island in a river, lake, or estuary

plum.英释: a small round juicy fruit which is dark red, purple, or yellow and has a single hard seed, or the tree that produces this fruit

wick.英释: the piece of thread in a candle, that burns when you light it

tern.英释: a black and white sea bird that has long wings and a tail with two points

germ.英释: a very small living thing that can make you ill

whip.英释: a long thin piece of rope or leather with a handle, that you hit animals with to make them move or that you hit someone with to punish them

edit.英释: to prepare a book, piece of film etc for printing or broadcasting by removing mistakes or parts that are not acceptable

darn.英释: to repair a hole in a piece of clothing by stitching wool over it

rosy.中释: 蔷薇色的, 玫瑰红色的

slay.英释: to kill someone – used especially in newspapers

zeal.英释: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

doom.英释: to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc

dune.英释: a hill made of sand near the sea or in the desert

lush.英释: plants that are lush grow many leaves and look healthy and strong

lint.英释: Lint is cotton or linen fabric which you can put on your skin if you have a cut

foil.英释: metal sheets that are as thin as paper, used for wrapping food

limy.中释: 含石灰的, 石灰似的

flag.英释: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization

lone.英释: used to talk about the only person or thing in a place, or the only person or thing that does something

dumb.英释: someone who is dumb is not able to speak at all. Many people think that this use is offensive

lash.英释: to hit a person or animal very hard with a whip, stick etc

pelt.中释: 投掷, 毛皮 v剥的皮, 投掷
pelt.英释: the skin of a dead animal, especially with the fur or hair still on it

Lowa.中释: 爱荷华州(美国中西部的一州)

pike.中释: 长枪, 梭子鱼 vt用矛刺穿
pike.英释: a large fish that eats other fish and lives in rivers and lakes

boon.英释: You can describe something as a boon when it makes life better or easier for someone

waxy.中释: 象蜡的,苍白的, 柔软的,
waxy.英释: like wax, or made of wax

tame.中释: (指动物)驯服的,平淡的 v驯养, 驯服
tame.英释: a tame animal or bird is not wild any longer, because it has been trained to live with people

scam.英释: a clever but dishonest way to get money

dash.中释: 冲撞, 破折号 v猛掷, 冲撞
dash.英释: an occasion when someone runs somewhere very quickly in order to get away from something or someone, or in order to reach them

yolk.英释: the yellow part in the centre of an egg

golf.中释: 高尔夫球 vi打高尔夫球
golf.英释: a game in which the players hit a small white ball into holes in the ground with a set of golf clubs, using as few hits as possible

lore.英释: knowledge or information about a subject, for example nature or magic, that is not written down but is passed from person to person

toil.中释: 苦工, 圈套 v费力地做

sift.英释: to examine information, documents etc carefully in order to find something out or decide what is important and what is not

neat.中释: 整洁的, 灵巧的, 优雅的

prod.英释: to quickly push something or someone with your finger or a pointed object

oval.英释: a shape like a circle, but wider in one direction than the other

gaze.英释: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so

disc.英释: a round flat shape or object

buzz.英释: a continuous noise like the sound of a  bee

exam.英释: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one

lark.英释: a small brown singing bird with long pointed wings

icon.英释: a small sign or picture on a computer screen that is used to start a particular operation

bust.英释: a model of someone’s head, shoulders, and upper chest, usually made of stone or metal

jolt.英释: to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way

rook.英释: a large black European bird like a  crow

feud.英释: to continue quarrelling for a long time, often in a violent way

hone.英释: a fine whetstone, esp for sharpening razors

soul.英释: the part of a person that is not physical, and that contains their character, thoughts, and feelings. Many people believe that a person’s soul continues to exist after they have died.

airy.英释: an airy room or building has plenty of fresh air because it is large or has a lot of windows

sway.英释: to move slowly from one side to another

sear.英释: To sear something means to burn its surface with a sudden intense heat

abut.英释: if one piece of land or a building abuts another, it is next to it or touches one side of it

gust.中释: 一阵狂风,（感情的）迸发，汹涌
gust.英释: a sudden strong movement of wind, air, rain etc

jibe.中释: 嘲笑, 与一致, 使转向
jibe.英释: To jibe means to say something rude or insulting that is intended to make another person look foolish

pont.英释: (in South Africa) a river ferry, esp one that is guided by a cable from one bank to the other

sack.英释: to dismiss someone from their job

veil.英释: to partly hide something so that it cannot be seen clearly

soup.英释: cooked liquid food, often containing small pieces of meat, fish, or vegetables

stew.英释: to cook something slowly in liquid

sour.英释: if a relationship or someone’s attitude sours, or if something sours it, it becomes unfriendly or unfavourable

wold.中释: 无树木的山地, 荒野

mime.英释: to describe or express something, using movements not words

dram.中释: 液量特兰(药衡系统中的容量单位),  少量
dram.英释: a small alcoholic drink, especially  whisky  – used especially in Scotland

brim.英释: if your eyes brim with tears, or if tears brim from your eyes, you start to cry

boot.英释: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg

tilt.中释: (使)倾斜, 以言词或文字抨击
tilt.英释: to move a part of your body, especially your head or chin, upwards or to the side

mess.英释: to make something look untidy or dirty

whim.英释: a sudden feeling that you would like to do or have something, especially when there is no important or good reason

spar.英释: a thick pole, especially one used on a ship to support sails or ropes

coax.英释: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

flue.英释: a metal pipe or tube that lets smoke or heat from a fire out of a building
